means: 令人忧愁的，使人沮丧的
令人忧愁地，使人沮丧地

sentence.Network_en: He always woke with a sense of deep sorrow and depressing loss.
sentence.Network_cn: 他醒来时总是满怀哀愁，抑郁惆怅。

sentence.Network_en: All in all, it appeared that a pretty depressing summer awaited Jones.
sentence.Network_cn: 总之，等待琼斯的似乎是一个相当令人沮丧的夏天。

sentence.Network_en: It must be really depressing listening to everybody's whinges.
sentence.Network_cn: 听每个人的抱怨肯定非常地郁闷。

entry.tran: 令人抑郁的;使人沮丧的;让人消沉的
entry.def: Something that is depressing makes you feel sad and disappointed.

example.tran: 昨天的失业数字令人沮丧。

example.ex: I'm rather keen to go on holiday in February because I think it's a very dismal, depressing month.
example.tran: 我很想 2 月份去度假，因为我觉得那是一个非常阴沉惨淡、令人抑郁的月份。

sentences.sentence: "the first dismal dispiriting days of November"

means.word_mean: 2. causing or suggestive of sorrow or gloom;

means.word_mean: 令人忧愁的,使人沮丧的

sentences.en: After the depressing events of the last few months, Mina felt that it was time to put a little joie de vivre back into their lives.
sentences.cn: 经历了前几个月许多令人沮丧的事情,麦娜觉得现在该小小地享受一下生活了。
